intro: Marrubium album, commonly known as white horehound, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy, grey-green leaves and pale blue to white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
